metadata.title: CVE-2023-52566 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: nilfs2:fix potential use after free in nilfs_gccache_submit_read_data() Innilfs_gccache_submit_read_data(), brelse(bh) is called to drop thereference count of bh when the call to nilfs_dat_translate() fails. If thereference count hits 0 and its owner page gets unlocked, bh may be freed.However, bh->b_page is dereferenced to put the page after that, which mayresult in a use-after-free bug. This patch moves the release operationafter unlocking and putting the page. NOTE: The function in question isonly called in GC, and in combination with current userland tools, addresstranslation using DAT does not occur in that function, so the code paththat causes this issue will not be executed. However, it is possible to runthat code path by intentionally modifying the userland GC library or bycalling the GC ioctl directly. [konishi.ryusuke@gmail.com: NOTE added tothe commit log]

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52566` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-254.288~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-254.288~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-254.288~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-254.288~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-254.288~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-254.288~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-254.288~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-254.288~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-254.288~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1054-aws - 4.4.0-1131.137
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1059-azure - 4.15.0-1177.192~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-254.288~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1131.137').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1177.192~14.04.1').
